programme.title: Five Easy Pieces
programme.desc: An oil-rigger who has cut himself off from his cultured, middle-class roots reluctantly returns to his family home, with his pregnant girlfriend in tow, after receiving word that his father is dying. However, the homecoming turns into a failure, as the psychological journey has a lasting impact on himself and those closest to him. Drama, with Jack Nicholson, Karen Black, Susan Anspach and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: Monsoon
programme.desc: A British-Vietnamese man returns to his birth country for the first time in more than 30 years. He was only eight when he and his family escaped Saigon as boat refugees during the Vietnam-American war. Now he embarks on a personal journey from Saigon to Hanoi to find a place to scatter his parents' ashes. Drama, starring Henry Golding, Parker Sawyers, David Tran and Molly Harris.(n)

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.(n)

programme.title: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
programme.desc: Queen Elizabeth I faces threats at home and abroad, as Mary, Queen of Scots plots against her while the King of Spain builds a vast armada to undertake an invasion of England. Unable to reconcile her feelings for the dashing Sir Walter Raleigh with her duty to her country, the monarch engineers a romance between the courtier and one of her ladies-in-waiting. Historical drama sequel, with Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush and Samantha Morton.(n)

programme.title: The Man with the Answers
programme.desc: A former diving champion and an eccentric student take an adventurous road trip of rediscovery. Romantic drama, starring Vasilis Magouliotis, Anton Weil and Stella Fyrogeni. In Greek, Italian, German and English.(n)

programme.title: One Life
programme.desc: In the months leading up to the Second World War, a young London stockbroker attempts to rescue hundreds of predominantly Jewish children from Nazi-occupied Czechoslovakia. Fifty years later he comes to terms with the guilt and grief he carried with him for decades. Drama based on a true story, starring Anthony Hopkins, Lena Olin and Johnny Flynn.(n)

programme.title: Five Easy Pieces
programme.desc: An oil-rigger who has cut himself off from his cultured, middle-class roots reluctantly returns to his family home, with his pregnant girlfriend in tow, after receiving word that his father is dying. However, the homecoming turns into a failure, as the psychological journey has a lasting impact on himself and those closest to him. Drama, with Jack Nicholson, Karen Black, Susan Anspach and Ralph Waite.(n)

programme.title: The Colour Room
programme.desc: Period drama telling the story of Clarice Cliff, who broke the glass ceiling and helped revolutionise the workplace in the 20th century. Clarice is a vivacious young factory worker in the industrial British midlands of the 1920s. Bursting with ideas for colours and shapes, she takes more and more dangerous risks, but manages to stay one step ahead of the workhouse and impress eccentric factory owner Colley Shorter with her talent and innovation. Starring Phoebe Dynevor, Matthew Goode and David Morrissey.(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.(n)

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.(n)

programme.title: Monsoon
programme.desc: A British-Vietnamese man returns to his birth country for the first time in more than 30 years. He was only eight when he and his family escaped Saigon as boat refugees during the Vietnam-American war. Now he embarks on a personal journey from Saigon to Hanoi to find a place to scatter his parents' ashes. Drama, starring Henry Golding, Parker Sawyers, David Tran and Molly Harris.(n)

programme.title: The Damned United
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling Brian Clough's ill-fated 44-day tenure as boss of Leeds United in 1974, after Don Revie's departure for the job of England's manager. Following his acrimonious split from Derby County and a brief spell at Brighton \u0026 Hove Albion, Clough arrived at Elland Road on a wave of controversy, after previously being an outspoken critic of the club, and struggled to find allies among the playing staff. With Michael Sheen, Timothy Spall, Jim Broadbent and Colm Meaney.(n)

programme.title: Babylon
programme.desc: A Rastafarian garage mechanic in a tough London neighbourhood heads up a mobile DJ crew and prepares to compete in a sound-systems competition. However, he has to contend with racism, violence and crime, and his life begins to unravel as he loses his job, is harassed by the police under stop-and-search laws and has his equipment destroyed by angry neighbours. Drama, with Brinsley Forde and Karl Howman.(n)

programme.title: High Noon
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef.(n)

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: A middle-class family take in a hulking homeless teenager, who has no education or skills to speak of. The indomitable wife encourages him to turn his life around, helping him to get the grades he needs for a college scholarship and hone his sporting skills to become an American football player. Fact-based drama, starring an Oscar-winning Sandra Bullock alongside Quinton Aaron and Tim McGraw.(n)

programme.title: Dallas Buyers Club
programme.desc: A man diagnosed with HIV and given 30 days to live discovers that many treatments for his condition are not available in the US. With the aid of a transsexual Aids patient, he sets up a scheme to smuggle the drugs into the country and distribute them to those in need. Fact-based drama, starring Oscar winners Matthew McConaughey and Jared Leto, with Jennifer Garner and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: The Colour Room
programme.desc: Period drama telling the story of Clarice Cliff, who broke the glass ceiling and helped revolutionise the workplace in the 20th century. programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
programme.desc: A shy man struggling to cope with a recent break-up is horrified to learn his impulsive former girlfriend has had all recollection of their relationship erased from her mind. He gets even by having the same treatment, but during the procedure he relives their time together and falls for her again, leaving him determined to keep his memories. Michel Gondry's surreal romantic drama, with Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Tom Wilkinson and Elijah Wood.(n)

programme.title: Sundown
programme.desc: Neil and Alice Bennett are the core of a wealthy family on holiday in Mexico, until a distant emergency cuts their trip short. When one relative disrupts the family's tight-knit order, simmering tensions rise to the fore. Drama, starring Tim Roth, Albertine Kotting McMillan and Samuel Bottomley.(n)

programme.title: The Blind Side
programme.desc: A middle-class family take in a hulking homeless teenager, who has no education or skills to speak of. programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.

programme.title: Hawaii
programme.desc: A 19th-century missionary and his wife try to bring Christianity to the natives of the Hawaiian islands, little realising that their incursion will forever change the attitude of the indigenous population. It's not long before the couple's differing viewpoints drive a wedge between them - leading to betrayal. Historical drama, starring Max von Sydow, Julie Andrews and Richard Harris.

programme.title: Ray
programme.desc: Biopic of soul singer Ray Charles, exploring his battle against racial bigotry, drug addiction and personal demons on his rise to stardom. Blind by the time he was seven, the musician flirted with several styles including gospel, jazz and country, and became known as one of the music industry's most innovative performers. Starring an Oscar-winning Jamie Foxx alongside Regina King and Kerry Washington.

programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
programme.desc: A shy man struggling to cope with a recent break-up is horrified to learn his impulsive former girlfriend has had all recollection of their relationship erased from her mind. He gets even by having the same treatment, but during the procedure he relives their time together and falls for her again, leaving him determined to keep his memories. Michel Gondry's surreal romantic drama, with Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Tom Wilkinson and Elijah Wood.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A teenager from Boston moves to a small conservative town, and discovers the council and a preacher have enforced a ban on loud music and dancing. He openly defies the harsh rules, revitalising the local youth and winning the heart of the reverend's daughter. Remake of the 1984 drama, with Kenny Wormald, Julianne Hough and Dennis Quaid.

programme.title: Sundown
programme.desc: Neil and Alice Bennett are the core of a wealthy family on holiday in Mexico, until a distant emergency cuts their trip short. When one relative disrupts the family's tight-knit order, simmering tensions rise to the fore. Drama, starring Tim Roth, Albertine Kotting McMillan and Samuel Bottomley.

programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. Starring Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Michael Kitchen, Klaus Maria Brandauer and Leslie Phillips.

programme.title: Boy Meets Boy
programme.desc: When two young men cross paths in Berlin, a simple afternoon in the big city soon takes on a much greater meaning. Drama, starring Matthew Morrison and Alexandros Koutsoulis.

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: Ray
programme.desc: Biopic of soul singer Ray Charles, exploring his battle against racial bigotry, drug addiction and personal demons on his rise to stardom. Blind by the time he was seven, the musician flirted with several styles including gospel, jazz and country, and became known as one of the music industry's most innovative performers. Starring an Oscar-winning Jamie Foxx alongside Regina King and Kerry Washington.

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: During the summer of 1957, ex-racecar driver Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy stalks the company he and his wife, Laura, built from nothing a decade earlier. Their tempestuous marriage struggles with the mourning for one son and the acknowledgement of another. Attempting to secure their survival, he rolls the dice on one race - 1,000 miles across Italy, the iconic Mille Miglia. Director Michael Mann's drama, starring Adam Driver and Jack O'Connell.

programme.title: Boy Meets Boy
programme.desc: When two young men cross paths in Berlin, a simple afternoon in the big city soon takes on a much greater meaning. Drama, starring Matthew Morrison and Alexandros Koutsoulis.

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenager's body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiner's 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry O'Connell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss.

programme.title: Out of Africa
programme.desc: Fact-based romantic drama based on the life of writer Karen Blixen, who, after relocating from Denmark to a farm in Nairobi for a marriage of convenience, embarked on a passionate and ill-fated love affair with an idealistic British adventurer. Starring Meryl Streep, Robert Redford, Michael Kitchen, Klaus Maria Brandauer and Leslie Phillips.

programme.title: Chuck Chuck Baby
programme.desc: Helen lives with her ex-husband, his 20-year-old girlfriend, their new baby, and his dying mother Gwen. Helen's life is a grind, but she has a chance at romance when a secret love returns. Writer/director Janis Pugh's drama, starring Louise Brealey and Annabel Scholey.

programme.title: Oslo
programme.desc: Drama based on the true story of negotiations between implacable enemies - the secret back-channel talks, unlikely friendships and quiet heroics of a small but committed group of Israelis, Palestinians and one Norwegian couple that led to the 1993 Oslo Peace Accords. Starring Ruth Wilson, Andrew Scott and Jeff Wilbusch.

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.

programme.title: Boy Meets Boy
programme.desc: When two young men cross paths in Berlin, a simple afternoon in the big city soon takes on a much greater meaning. Drama, starring Matthew Morrison and Alexandros Koutsoulis.

programme.title: Save the Cinema
programme.desc: Drama telling the true story of Liz Evans from Carmarthen, south-west Wales, who started a campaign in the 1990s to save the town's Lyric Cinema. With the help of local politician Richard Goodridge, Liz manages to persuade Steven Spielberg to show a premiere of Jurassic Park at the Lyric. Starring Samantha Morton, Tom Felton and Jonathan Pryce.

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson in her final film.

programme.title: Ghost
programme.desc: The spirit of murdered executive Sam Wheat tries to find a way to help his girlfriend Molly Jensen bring killer Carl Bruner to justice, and enlists the aid of fraudulent medium Oda Mae Brown - who is amazed and baffled when her supposed psychic powers turn out to be all too real. Romantic fantasy, starring Patrick Swayze, Demi Moore, Tony Goldwyn and a Whoopi Goldberg, who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her role as Brown.

programme.title: Stand By Me
programme.desc: Four 12-year-old best friends embark on a life-changing adventure in the Oregon wilderness in search of a missing teenager's body, unaware of the trials and triumphs that await them. Rob Reiner's 1950s-set coming-of-age drama, based on a novella by Stephen King, starring River Phoenix, Wil Wheaton, Jerry O'Connell, Corey Feldman, Kiefer Sutherland and Richard Dreyfuss.

programme.title: Chuck Chuck Baby
programme.desc: Helen lives with her ex-husband, his 20-year-old girlfriend, their new baby, and his dying mother Gwen. Helen's life is a grind, but she has a chance at romance when a secret love returns. Writer/director Janis Pugh's drama, starring Louise Brealey and Annabel Scholey.

programme.title: Oslo
programme.desc: Drama based on the true story of negotiations between implacable enemies - the secret back-channel talks, unlikely friendships and quiet heroics of a small but committed group of Israelis, Palestinians and one Norwegian couple that led to the 1993 Oslo Peace Accords. Starring Ruth Wilson, Andrew Scott and Jeff Wilbusch.

programme.title: Through a Glass Darkly
programme.desc: A former mental institution inmate returns to her family, but faces an uphill struggle to readjust to life in the outside world. Ingmar Bergman's drama, starring Harriet Andersson and Max von Sydow. In Swedish.

programme.title: Cries and Whispers
programme.desc: Agnes, a woman dying of cancer, is visited in her remote home by her two sisters. Far from offering comfort, their arrival brings long-buried family conflicts bubbling to the surface, with tensions rising as Agnes' health deteriorates. Ingmar Bergman's drama, starring Harriet Andersson, Liv Ullmann and Ingrid Thulin. In Swedish.(n)

programme.title: Phantom Thread
programme.desc: Celebrated British dressmaker Reynolds Woodcock falls in love with Alma, a shy but strong-willed waitress who refuses to conform to his meticulous way of living. Paul Thomas Anderson's Oscar-winning drama, starring Daniel Day-Lewis in his final role before retirement, alongside Vicky Krieps and Lesley Manville.(n)

programme.title: Save the Cinema
programme.desc: Drama telling the true story of Liz Evans from Carmarthen, south-west Wales, who started a campaign in the 1990s to save the town's Lyric Cinema. With the help of local politician Richard Goodridge, Liz manages to persuade Steven Spielberg to show a premiere of Jurassic Park at the Lyric. Starring Samantha Morton, Tom Felton and Jonathan Pryce.(n)

programme.title: Burlesque
programme.desc: A woman goes to work as a cocktail waitress at a burlesque club which is teetering on the brink of closure. The manager gives her the chance to perform and she has soon become the venue's star attraction, drawing the attention of a sleazy developer with plans for the site. Musical drama, starring Cher, Christina Aguilera, Cam Gigandet and Stanley Tucci.(n)

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Romantic fantasy, starring Patrick Swayze, Demi Moore, Tony Goldwyn and a Whoopi Goldberg, who won the Best Supporting Actress Oscar for her role as Brown.(n)

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: A rebellious, hip-swinging student from the city moves to a small religious community, where he instantly clashes with an old-school fire-and-brimstone preacher - who has banned dancing and rock 'n' roll because he considers them immoral. Drama, starring Kevin Bacon, Lori Singer, John Lithgow, Chris Penn, Dianne Wiest and Sarah Jessica Parker.(n)

programme.title: A Star Is Born
programme.desc: Following a gig, fading music star Jackson Maine happens upon Ally, a nightclub singer-songwriter. Their instant chemistry leads to a tempestuous romance as he helps her on the road to stardom. However, Jackson's alcoholism has explosive repercussions as her career blossoms. Oscar-winning drama, starring Lady Gaga, Bradley Cooper, who also directed, and Sam Elliott.(n)

programme.title: Through a Glass Darkly
programme.desc: A former mental institution inmate returns to her family, but faces an uphill struggle to readjust to life in the outside world. Ingmar Bergman's drama, starring Harriet Andersson and Max von Sydow. In Swedish.(n)

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview-April 2025
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on Sky Cinema, plus other highlights showing on Sky.(n)

programme.title: Sneaks
programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. However, when a shady shoe collector steals his sister, Ty, is forced to venture out into the world, and onto the streets of New York, to rescue her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: My Penguin Friend
programme.desc: A fisherman finds a friend in a lost penguin, and after taking the bird under his wing, he finds a new sense of joy. Director David Schurmann's drama inspired by a true story, starring Jean Reno and Adriana Barraza.(n)

programme.title: Noah's Ark
programme.desc: Tom and Vini are mice who stow away on Noah's ark. They must use their musical talents to enter a competition and help maintain peace among the animals. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Rodrigo Santoro and Marcelo Adnet.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me 4
programme.desc: Diabolical nemesis Maxime Le Mal and his femme fatale girlfriend Valentina target Anti-Villain League agent Gru, girlfriend Lucy, their girls Margo, Edith and Agnes and new addition Gru Jr. The family goes on the run while the Minions invade AVL HQ. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell and Will Ferrell.(n)

programme.title: Sneaks
programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. However, when a shady shoe collector steals his sister, Ty, is forced to venture out into the world, and onto the streets of New York, to rescue her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: Borat Subsequent Moviefilm
programme.desc: Borat returns from Kazakhstan to America intent on giving his fifteen year old daughter to the vice president. While on his mission, Borat also learns more about the American culture, the COVID-19 pandemic and political elections. Spoof documentary sequel, starring Sacha Baron Cohen.(n)

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me 4
programme.desc: Diabolical nemesis Maxime Le Mal and his femme fatale girlfriend Valentina target Anti-Villain League agent Gru, girlfriend Lucy, their girls Margo, Edith and Agnes and new addition Gru Jr. The family goes on the run while the Minions invade AVL HQ. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell and Will Ferrell.(n)

programme.title: Coming 2 America
programme.desc: As King Jaffe Joffer, ruler of the prosperous nation of Zamunda, takes his final breath, pampered crown prince Akeem faces a constitutional crisis without a male heir to ascend the throne. An elderly shaman unexpectedly discloses that Akeem has an illegitimate son in New York. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy and Arsenio Hall.(n)

programme.title: Cuckoo
programme.desc: A 17-year-old moves with her family to a resort where things are not what they seem. Writer/director Tilman Slinger's horror thriller, starring Hunter Schafer, Jan Bluthardt and Dan Stevens.(n)

programme.title: The Wasp
programme.desc: Estranged childhood friends Heather and Carla reunite for a cup of tea after not having spoken in many years. At their meeting, Heather presents an unexpected proposition that will change their lives forever. Director Guillem Morales' thriller, starring Naomie Harris and Natalie Dormer.(n)

programme.title: Afraid
programme.desc: Computer engineering company executive Curtis is coerced into testing a new digital assistant named AIA to secure a lucrative business contract with two tech geniuses. At first, the omnipresent artificial intelligence simplifies day-to-day life. However, AIA becomes dangerously protective of the clan. Writer/director Chris Weitz's sci-fi horror, starring John Cho, Katherine Waterston and Keith Carradine.(n)

programme.title: Skincare
programme.desc: Small business owner Hope Goldman performs facials to celebrity clientele and powerful businesswomen. She is poised to launch her own skincare line, but is in arrears with rent on her store at a shopping complex. A rival called Angel opens in close proximity and soon after, her email is hacked and tyres slashed. Hope is convinced that Angel is the culprit and enlists hired thug Armen and young beau Jordan to extinguish the competition. Director Austin Peters' thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks and Lewis Pullman.

programme.title: Babes
programme.desc: After New York yoga teacher Dawn goes into labour, best friend Eden offers wise-cracking support to herald the safe arrival of a baby girl. Later, Eden falls pregnant after meeting an actor, who subsequently ghosts her. Comedy, co-written by and starring Ilana Glazer, with Michelle Buteau and John Carroll Lynch.

programme.desc: Families discover the lure of the Old West as they settle in territories from Wyoming to Kansas during the 19th century. Western, starring Kevin Costner, who also co-wrote and directed, with Sienna Miller and Sam Worthington.

programme.title: Transformers One
programme.desc: Years before the sentient robots became arch enemies, Optimus Prime and Megatron were friends on their home planet of Cybertron. However, their feud changes the universe forever. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Chris Hemsworth, Brian Tyree Henry, Scarlett Johansson and Keegan-Michael Key.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me 4
programme.desc: Diabolical nemesis Maxime Le Mal and his femme fatale girlfriend Valentina target Anti-Villain League agent Gru, girlfriend Lucy, their girls Margo, Edith and Agnes and new addition Gru Jr. The family goes on the run while the Minions invade AVL HQ. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell and Will Ferrell.(n)

programme.title: Sneaks
programme.desc: Ty is a designer trainer who lives a life of luxury and comfort. However, when a shady shoe collector steals his sister, Ty, is forced to venture out into the world, and onto the streets of New York, to rescue her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Anthony Mackie, Keith David and Laurence Fishburne.(n)

programme.title: My Penguin Friend
programme.desc: A fisherman finds a friend in a lost penguin, and after taking the bird under his wing, he finds a new sense of joy. Director David Schurmann's drama inspired by a true story, starring Jean Reno and Adriana Barraza.(n)

programme.title: Despicable Me 4
programme.desc: Diabolical nemesis Maxime Le Mal and his femme fatale girlfriend Valentina target Anti-Villain League agent Gru, girlfriend Lucy, their girls Margo, Edith and Agnes and new addition Gru Jr. The family goes on the run while the Minions invade AVL HQ. Animated sequel, with the voices of Steve Carell and Will Ferrell.(n)

programme.title: Transformers One
programme.desc: Years before the sentient robots became arch enemies, Optimus Prime and Megatron were friends on their home planet of Cybertron. However, their feud changes the universe forever. Animated sci-fi adventure, with the voices of Chris Hemsworth, Brian Tyree Henry, Scarlett Johansson and Keegan-Michael Key.(n)

programme.title: It Ends With Us
programme.desc: Lily Bloom returns to her childhood home of Plethora, Maine, to attend the funeral of her father, the former town mayor who beat his wife behind closed doors. Upon returning to Boston, Lily is attracted to Ryle Kincaid, a neurosurgeon with a dark side, and old flame Atlas Corrigan. Drama based on the bestselling novel, starring Blake Lively, Justin Baldoni, Jenny Slate and Brandon Sklenar.(n)

programme.title: Cuckoo
programme.desc: A 17-year-old moves with her family to a resort where things are not what they seem. Writer/director Tilman Slinger's horror thriller, starring Hunter Schafer, Jan Bluthardt and Dan Stevens.(n)

programme.title: Afraid
programme.desc: Computer engineering company executive Curtis is coerced into testing a new digital assistant named AIA to secure a lucrative business contract with two tech geniuses. At first, the omnipresent artificial intelligence simplifies day-to-day life. However, AIA becomes dangerously protective of the clan. Writer/director Chris Weitz's sci-fi horror, starring John Cho, Katherine Waterston and Keith Carradine.(n)

programme.title: Babes
programme.desc: After New York yoga teacher Dawn goes into labour, best friend Eden offers wise-cracking support to herald the safe arrival of a baby girl. Later, Eden falls pregnant after meeting an actor, who subsequently ghosts her. Comedy, co-written by and starring Ilana Glazer, with Michelle Buteau and John Carroll Lynch.(n)

programme.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
programme.desc: The first part of Peter Jackson's fantasy adventure trilogy based on the book by JRR Tolkien, starring Martin Freeman and Ian McKellen. Encouraged by the wizard Gandalf, Bilbo Baggins leaves the comfort of his home in the Shire to join a band of dwarves in their quest to reclaim the Kingdom of Erebor from the dragon Smaug. It is a journey that will see the plucky hobbit encounter goblins, orcs and

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Martin Freeman and Ian McKellen. Bilbo Baggins marches on towards the Lonely Mountain flanked by Thorin and his band of dwarves. There he is destined to encounter the fire-breathing dragon Smaug, guardian of a precious, mystical stone that bestows great power on anyone who possesses it.

programme.title: The Cinema List: Black British Actors
programme.desc: This Black History Month, join us as we take a look at the work of some exceptionally talented Black British actors, from Naomie Harris to Idris Elba and beyond.

programme.title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure, the conclusion to Peter Jackson's trilogy, starring Martin Freeman and Ian McKellen. Bilbo and his dwarf friends are facing enemies on all sides. programme.title: Jules
programme.desc: Residents of a small Pennsylvania town are disturbed when a UFO crashes into a back garden. Director Marc Turtletaub's comedy drama, starring Ben Kingsley, Harriet Harris and Jane Curtin.

programme.title: The Bricklayer
programme.desc: Former CIA agent Steve Vail is reactivated when an extortionist targets the agency. Director Renny Harlin's thriller based on the Noah Boyd novel, starring Aaron Eckhart, Nina Dobrev and Clifton Collins Jr.

programme.title: Robin and the Hoods
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure starring Darcey Ewart and Naomie Harris. Robin is an 11-year-old girl who plays imaginative games with her friends, the Hoods, on the wooded land near to their homes. They engage in pretend battles against rival gangs, but a greater challenge emerges when a property developer, "Clipboard", threatens to transform their kingdom into a leisure facility.

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. As the Second World War rages, American fashion model-turned-photographer Elizabeth "Lee" Miller defies the expectations of the era and travels to mainland Europe as a war correspondent for Vogue. Reporting from the frontline, Miller captures indelible images of the conflict, including the horrors found in the Nazi concentration camps at Buchenwald and Dac

programme.title: Harold and the Purple Crayon
programme.desc: Harold and pals Moose and Porcupine live in a hand-drawn world of limitless possibilities. The trio become concerned when the Old Man, who narrates their illustrated existence, suddenly falls silent. Using his magical crayon, Harold draws a door to the real world and tumbles into the present day as a flesh-and-blood man, who collides head-on with widow Terry and her young son, Mel. Family adventur

programme.title: Ferrari
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Adam Driver and PenÃ©lope Cruz. Enzo Ferrari and his wife Laura have equal shares in their car-manufacturing company, but their marriage is in tatters following the death of their son, while the business is in financial peril. With the 1957 Mille Miglia endurance race looming, Enzo seeks victory for Ferrari, whatever the cost.

programme.title: We're the Millers
programme.desc: Comedy starring Jennifer Aniston and Jason Sudeikis. In order to repay a debt to his drug supplier, small-time pot dealer David Clark agrees to smuggle a shipment of marijuana across the Mexican border. However, to carry out the deception, David recruits a stripper and two teenagers to pose as his family.

programme.title: Lee
programme.desc: Biographical drama starring Kate Winslet. programme.title: Hypnotic
programme.desc: Police detective Danny Rourke is haunted by the abduction of his seven-year-old daughter Minnie from a park. During a bank heist, Danny discovers a photo of his daughter with an instruction to find someone called Dell Rayne. Evidence leads to a psychic Diana Cruz, who introduces the cop to the unseen world of hypnotics - people with the ability to control how we perceive the world. Action thriller

programme.title: The Killer

programme.title: Gran Turismo
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old Jann Mardenborough beats thousands of other gamers in the GT Academy competition organised by marketing executive Danny Moore. Drama, starring David Harbour, Orlando Bloom and Archie Madekwe.

programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Adam Sandler, Kate Beckinsale and Christopher Walken. programme.title: Out of Darkness
programme.desc: In the Stone Age, a gang of early humans face a mystical being hellbent on hunting them down. Prehistoric horror, starring Iola Evans and Arno LÃ¼ning. The dialogue is in a specially contructed language and features subtitles.

programme.desc: A group of students unknowingly release an unspeakable evil trapped within a cursed deck of tarot cards. Horror, starring Harriet Slater, Adain Bradley and Jacob Batalon.

programme.title: The Three Musketeers: Milady
programme.desc: Swashbuckling historical adventure sequel starring FranÃ§ois Civil, Vincent Cassel and Eva Green. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Jeremy Iro

programme.title: The Meg
programme.desc: Action horror thriller starring Jason Statham and Li Bingbing. After failing to save the crew of an imperilled submarine, deep sea rescue diver Jonas Taylor is unfairly branded a drunk and a coward. Five years later, he spies an opportunity to prove everybody wrong when he is approached to aid a team of researchers in their fight against a giant prehistoric shark.

programme.desc: A mercenary is assigned a target on a flight, but when rival assassins board the plane, the hunter and the hunted are forced to team up. Action thriller, starring Josh Hartnett, Katee Sackhoff and Julian Kostov.

programme.title: Click
programme.desc: Fantasy comedy starring Adam Sandler, Kate Beckinsale and Christopher Walken. Architect Michael Newman's will to succeed at work has come at the expense of quality time with his beautiful wife and children. But then Michael comes into possession of a remote control that allows him to pause, rewind and fast-forward his life just as he pleases.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: Action comedy adventure based on the 1970s TV series, starring Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu, and featuring Bill Murray. When a top computer boffin is kidnapped, crime-busting trio Natalie, Dylan and Alex become involved in a game of betrayal and deception.

programme.title: The Beekeeper
programme.desc: An apparently unassuming man finds someone very important to him has been scammed and driven to harm. Revealed as a former operative of a powerful and clandestine organisation known as 'Beekeepers', he sets out on a brutal quest of vengeance, hunting those responsible for the incident, who have seriously underestimated how much of a threat he is. Action thriller, starring Jason Statham, Jeremy Iro

programme.title: The Meg
programme.desc: Action horror thriller starring Jason Statham and Li Bingbing. After failing to save the crew of an imperilled submarine, deep sea rescue diver Jonas Taylor is unfairly branded a drunk and a coward. Five years later, he spies an opportunity to prove everybody wrong when he is approached to aid a team of researchers in their fight against a giant prehistoric shark.

programme.title: Meg 2: The Trench
programme.desc: Underwater rescue expert Jonas Taylor leads a research team on an exploratory dive into the deepest depths of the ocean. However, a greedy mining operation threatens the team's safety and unleashes a school of voracious 75ft-long megalodon sharks. Director Ben Wheatley's comedy thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham and Cliff Curtis.

programme.title: Absolution
programme.desc: Crime drama starring Liam Neeson. An ageing career criminal and former boxer discovers he has developed a neurodegenerative disease that gives him only months to live. His flashes of memory loss at work soon cause trouble, but redemption beckons when he attempts to reconnect with his estranged daughter and grandson.
